item.title: Art and absurdity of redrawing lines -- and then crossing them
item.description: We've come a long way from the country's first-ever gerrymander, which involved two future presidents vying to get elected to the first Congress.

item.title: When Academia Invites Geopolitical Risk
item.description: Scholars who rely on access to China or funding from Chinese sources often steer clear of politically sensitive topics.

item.title: Jim Acosta Pushes the Bounds of Decency, Again
item.description: The ex-CNN personality conjured an AI replica of a Parkland shooting victim for an ‘interview’ — what was he thinking?

item.title: Wrist Slap For Man Who Attacked Pro-Lifers Proves The FACE Act Was Always A Lawfare Tool
item.description: Until Congress passes the FACE Act Repeal Act, pro-lifers are still vulnerable to further abuse -- both legal and physical.
